intro: Chamaerops ghiesbreghtii, commonly known as the windmill palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in coastal areas with mild, temperate climates. The plant is characterized by its stiff, fan-shaped leaves that radiate from a central stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into edible, sweet fruits. Chamaerops ghiesbreghtii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
